page.title: 03BRICK HOUSES- SUMMERSEAT
page.content: Originally there were ten rows of terraced houses, built in brick for the people who worked at{Joshua {Hoyle's Mill.}They were about twenty metres apart and so were very dark inside. They were{'back to back'} houses, so each house had one room upstairs and one downstairs with an attic room. Many of the houses have fallen into disrepair, and so it was decided to {renovate}them. In 1985 three of the rows were knocked down to provide extra light and gardens for those remaining. The people living in the houses had the option to buy them and then they are having grants to renovate them. The whole scheme is expected to take three to four years.
